title: How to Transfer Contacts from iPhone to Gmail

steps.title: Enable your Contacts to sync to iCloud.
steps.content: Enable your Contacts to sync to iCloud. On your iPhone, do the following: Open the Settings app. Look for the gray gear icon on the home screen. Tap on your name at the top. Tap iCloud . Tap the switch next to "Contacts" to turn it on (green).

steps.title: Open a browser on your computer and go to https://www.icloud.com/.
steps.content: Open a browser on your computer and go to https://www.icloud.com/ . You can use any browser, such as Chrome, Firefox, or Safari.

steps.title: Sign in to your iCloud account.
steps.content: Sign in to your iCloud account. Enter your Apple ID followed by your password and click the gray arrow or hit ↵ Enter .

steps.title: Click Contacts.
steps.content: Click Contacts . This is indicated with an address book icon.

steps.title: Select the contact or contacts you wish to transfer.
steps.content: Select the contact or contacts you wish to transfer. Click on a single contact to select it. Hold Ctrl + A or ⌘ Command + A to select all contacts. To select multiple contacts, hold Ctrl or ⌘ Command while clicking on each contact. Or, click on a contact, hold down ⇧ Shift , and click on another contact. This selects all contacts in between.

steps.title: Click on the gear icon.
steps.content: Click on the gear icon. This is in the bottom left corner of the screen.

steps.title: Select Export vCard….
steps.content: Select Export vCard… . This is near the bottom of the menu.

steps.title: Save the file to your computer.
steps.content: Save the file to your computer. Choose a location to save the contacts to. Some browsers, such as Chrome, automatically save downloads to your Downloads folder instead of allowing you to specify a location.

steps.title: Open Google Contacts.
steps.content: Open Google Contacts. While in Gmail or another Google app, click on the square of dots in the top right corner and select Contacts . You can also go to https://contacts.google.com/ and sign in with your Google account.

steps.title: Click Import.
steps.content: Click Import . This is in the left panel. If you do not see the left panel, click on the 3 horizontal lines in the top left to show the panel.

steps.title: Click Select file.
steps.content: Click Select file . This will open the file explorer window.

steps.title: Go to the location where your vCard was saved to.
steps.content: Go to the location where your vCard was saved to. Check the '"Downloads" folder, or navigate to the folder if you saved it in a different place.

steps.title: Double-click on the vCard file.
steps.content: Double-click on the vCard file. You can also select the file and click Open . Look for the file with ".vcf" at the end.

steps.title: Click Import.
steps.content: Click Import . This will import the contacts to your Google Contacts, which is accessible by Gmail [1] X Research source .

steps.title: Open the Settings app on your iPhone.
steps.content: Open the Settings app on your iPhone. Look for the gray gear icon on your home screen.

steps.title: Tap Passwords & Accounts.
steps.content: Tap Passwords & Accounts . This is near the middle, and is indicated with a key icon in a gray box.

steps.title: Tap Gmail.
steps.content: Tap Gmail . If you do not see this option, do the following to add your Gmail account: Tap Add Account . Tap Google . Tap Continue . Sign in with your Google account credentials.

steps.title: Turn the switch on next to Contacts.
steps.content: Turn the switch on next to Contacts. It will turn green when it is on.

steps.title: Tap Save.
steps.content: Tap Save . This is in the upper right. This will automatically sync your iPhone contacts to Google Contacts, which is accessible by Gmail.
